sn47.50:4.3: The defilements of sensuality, desire for rebirth, and ignorance.
sn47.50:4.5: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation should be developed to give up these three defilements.
sn47.50:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.50:5.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.50:5.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
